title: [bug] Context menu creation in Javascript is broken

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

It seems the context menu creation from Javascript side is currently broken. The `Promise` returned from `Menu.new()` never resolves. It just hangs forever.

### Reproduction

1. Create the sample app with `--beta`.
2. In the `greet()` function of main.ts, add this line at beginning:
```
    const item = await MenuItem.new({
        text: 'Hello',
        action: () => { console.log('World') },
    })
    Menu.new().then(menu => { menu.append(item) })
```
3. Add import `import { Menu, MenuItem } from '@tauri-apps/api/menu'`.
4. Add capacity "menu:allow-new" and "menu:allow-append".
5. Run the app. Click the greet button. The app hangs. Nothing shows up in the console.

### Expected behavior

Using context menu should not hang the app. It was working before today's update.

### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

Another thing seemingly happens after today's update. Whenever I launch the app in dev mode, a new directory with gibberish name is created in the same directory of the executable (`src-tauri\out\debug`), which houses the EBWebView subdirectory. That directory should be located at `$LOCALAPPDATA/<app_identifier>/`.
